channel.title: Projects on Remco van Dijk
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Remco van Dijk

item.title: MSc Thesis
item.description: I’m currently doing my Master’s thesis entitled: “Fault Injection Attacks on Trusted Execution for RISC-V Cores” at the CAES group at the University of Twente. What is Fault Injection? Link to heading I will write a proper article here when I find the time. For now, I found a nice illustration that encapsulates the concept of voltage glitching to perform a fault injection (credit to VoidStar Security): Why RISC-V? Link to heading For my attack target, I’m using hardware that implements the RISC-V open Instruction Set Architecture (ISA).
